item.title: Call For Paper
item.description: SRE Summer Camp will take place on September 3-4, 2022 at La Dynamo Chamb√©ry. While waiting for the D-day do not hesitate to propose your talk at CFP. It is now open until August 21, 2022. Categories Principes and best practices SRE On-call Monitoring Incident management Cloud Native tools IaC (Infrastructure as Code) Experience feedback WTF and other : if your talk does not fit in any of the previous categories.

item.title: Code of Conduct
item.description: SRE France Summer Camp is an event organised for all to offer an inclusive experiment without harassment (sexual, physical, origins, beliefs, etc.) Harassment in any forms is prohibited, in the society and in the event itself (including slide decks and talks). People that do not respect this could be sanctionned and banned from the event. At any time, it’s possible to contact: srefranceasso+summercamp@gmail.com if you witnessed suspiscious activity or if you lived a violent situation.

item.title: De SRE √† DRE, comment les pratiques SRE influencent le monde de la data
item.description: Dans ce talk, nous verrons comment les data engineers s’inspirent de leurs homologues SRE pour construire des infrastructures data plus r√©silientes. En effet, le monde de la data devenant de plus en plus mature, les probl√©matiques li√©es √† la gestion d’applications en production apparaissent. Les data engineers ne sont pas forc√©ment form√©s et outill√©s pour les adresser. C’est donc du c√¥t√© des SRE qu’ils peuvent se pencher pour trouver de bonnes id√©es.

item.title: FAQs
item.description: SRE France Summer Camp - what is it? It’s a two days event mixing talks and outdoor activies to encourage discussions around the topics seen during the conferences. SRE France is an association that organizes meetups and events around DevOps and SRE topics in France. Where and when? 3rd and 4th of September 2022 at La Dynamo Chamb√©ry (24 Avenue Daniel Rops, 73000 Chamb√©ry). How to come? Directly by train from Paris or from Lyon, Grenoble or Annecy.

item.title: Kube Careers
item.description: Kube Careers Kube Careers is the job board for Kubernetes focused jobs. Here is what you can expect: Clear salary ranges. So you know when it’s worth applying. Only Kubernetes jobs. Have you ever found those pesky job ads that mention Kubernetes, but you end up working on 100% legacy codebase. Well, we don’t list those. Honest job ads. For every job, we ask ourselves, “is this something I’d be happy to apply to?

item.title: Kube Events
item.description: Kube Events When is the next Kube-related conference? (apart from KubeCon, of course) Did you know that there was a meetup last week that covered Kubernetes node scaling with Karpenter? When is the next in-person conference? Wouldn’t it be great if there was a website where you could see all upcoming Kubernetes events? Enter Kube Events. Kube Events has a simple goal: surfacing the best upcoming Kubernetes events around you and online.

item.title: Kubernetes @ no-scale
item.description: Kubernetes est souvent pr√©sent√© comme l’outil de gestion pour les grandes entreprises, les grands d√©ploiements. Dans ce talk, √©tablie sur une exp√©rience r√©elle @themecloud.io, nous verrons comment Kubernetes profite √©galement aux petits projets, aux (toutes) petites √©quipes avec pourtant beaucoup de “legacy”.

item.title: Lightning Talks
item.description: Une s√©rie de pr√©sentations spontan√©es de moins de 5 minutes avec de slides ou pas. Cycle de release de Flatcar par Mathieu Tortuyaux MEPIE: un framework DevOps est possible ! par Guilhem Lettron Refactorisation Terraform par Arthur Busser Mirabelle par Mathieu Corbin

item.title: Maximizing development experience by minimizing cost: A dream come true with ArgoCD and Istio's overlays
item.description: Companies struggle to provide an adequate development environment: rapid growth leads to a focus on production environments, while the developer teams scale at least as much the company and little to no effort is put on their daily work experience. An easy solution is to deploy a full application ecosystem for each developer, but it costs too much, so companies share those environments between developers. They should not. As an ex-developer, I am convinced that each and every developer should be able to test new features without risking impacting other developers.

item.title: Resilience
item.description: The platform that supports cancer patients on their path to resilience. The problem we want to solve Cancer patients do not benefit from any personalised follow-up of their treatments, even though they are fighting a double battle: against the disease, but also against the side effects. Our mission Universalise medical excellence in oncology to enable people to live better and longer. Our vision In the face of inequalities in access to medicine, which are particularly tangible for cancer patients, technology must be placed at the service of oncology in order to improve access to knowledge and the effectiveness of therapies.

item.title: Risques, erreurs et expertise
item.description: Bien que largement d√©laiss√©, la gestion du risque est pourtant √† la base du m√©tier de SRE. Dans ce talk, explorons le lien √©troit entre risques, erreurs et innovation. Mais, attention, car la route est sem√©e de pi√®ges et d’embuches. Et ce qui fait la diff√©rence : l’expertise.

item.title: Secrets, race conditions, and statelessness
item.description: Race conditions during service upgrades are the worst. Particularly when a service and its configuration are both updated at the same time, asynchronously, and something goes subtly wrong. In some cases, we end up with inconsistency between multiples instances of the same stateless service. But wait, isn’t the whole point of a stateless service that all instances are identical in every way? Well, yes. But it’s easy to make your services a tiny bit stateful without realising it, and a lot of us have been doing just that.

item.title: Une CLI pour les gouverner toutes
item.description: L’√©criture de scripts fait partie int√©grante de nos m√©tiers. On retrouve pourtant tr√®s souvent les m√™mes probl√®mes en entreprise sur comment ces scripts sont √©crits et distribu√©s, comme par exemple: Des scripts souvent tr√®s sp√©cifiques et donc peu r√©utilisables Des scripts diss√©min√©s dans de multiples d√©p√¥ts git, voir non versionn√©s ou m√™me non partag√©s Une qualit√© globale assez faible sur le code de ces scripts, notamment √† cause de l’utilisation de langages comme bash Je d√©crirai dans ce lightning talk comment r√©soudre ces probl√©matiques et expliquerai comment et pourquoi nous avons d√©velopp√© qontoctl chez Qonto.
